response_1.original:
Deciding whether to quit your job and move abroad immediately depends on several personal factors:

• Financial readiness: Do you have savings to cover relocation and living expenses for at least three to six months?  
• Career impact: Will leaving harm your long-term prospects, or might you negotiate a sabbatical?  
• Emotional and social support: Can you adapt to a new culture and build a network?  
• Research and test run: Consider taking an extended trip first to gauge your comfort level and logistical needs.  
• Backup plan: Ensure you have a way to return or reenter the job market if things don’t unfold as expected.  

A thoughtful plan—budgeting, visas, housing research, and pilot visits—will help you decide whether to take the leap now, postpone for more preparation, or explore compromise options such as remote work or temporary relocation.
